definitions: give something valuable or meaningful as a gift or honor
formally confer an honor title or award upon someone
examples: The king bestowed lands upon his loyal knights
Her grandmother bestowed the family heirloom upon her
The university bestowed an honorary degree upon the scientist
The committee bestowed the prestigious award on the author

definitions: risk money or something valuable on the outcome of an uncertain event
express strong confidence or certainty about something happening or being true
examples: He bet fifty dollars on the horse race
They bet their savings on the new business venture
I bet she'll arrive late to the meeting again
You can bet that prices will increase next year

definitions: be disloyal to someone who trusts you by harming or deceiving them
unintentionally reveal or show something meant to be hidden or secret
examples: He betrayed his best friend to save himself
The spy betrayed her country for money
Her trembling voice betrayed her nervousness
His expression betrayed no emotion during the interview

definitions: cut a sloping edge or surface on wood glass or other material
examples: The carpenter beveled the edges of the mirror frame
You need to bevel the corners for a professional finish

definitions: be cautious and alert to dangers or problems that may occur
examples: Beware of the dog when entering the property
Travelers should beware of pickpockets in crowded areas

definitions: argue about trivial matters in an annoying persistent way
examples: The siblings bickered constantly over the remote control
The committee members bickered about the meeting schedule

definitions: travel or go somewhere by riding a bicycle
examples: She bicycles to work every morning
They bicycled through the countryside on their vacation

definitions: offer a particular price for something especially at an auction
tell or command someone to do something in a formal way
make an effort or attempt to achieve or obtain something
examples: She bid two hundred dollars for the antique vase
Several companies bid on the construction project
The king bid his servants prepare the feast
The host bid the guests farewell at midnight
The senator made a bid for the presidency
The team is bidding for their third championship title

definitions: travel or go somewhere by riding a bicycle or motorcycle
examples: He bikes to the gym three times a week
We biked along the coastal path yesterday

definitions: send someone a statement of charges for payment
advertise or describe someone or something in a particular way
examples: The hospital billed us for the emergency treatment
The lawyer bills clients by the hour
The event was billed as the concert of the year
They billed him as the next great novelist

definitions: provide lodging for soldiers especially in civilian homes or buildings
examples: The army billeted troops in the local school
Soldiers were billeted with families throughout the village

definitions: throw something away into a waste container
store items in a container or compartment for organization
examples: She binned the expired food from the refrigerator
Just bin those old magazines
We binned the winter clothes until next season
The warehouse bins products by category

definitions: tie or fasten something tightly with rope string or similar material
impose a legal or moral obligation on someone to do something
cause things or people to be united together through shared experience
examples: He bound the packages with strong twine
The prisoner's hands were bound behind his back
The contract binds both parties to the agreement
She felt bound by her promise to help
Common interests bind the community members together
Shared experiences bound them in lasting friendship

definitions: indulge in an activity especially eating or drinking to excess
examples: He binged on junk food during the weekend
She tends to binge watch entire series in one sitting

definitions: beat or whip someone with a birch rod as punishment
examples: Teachers used to birch students for misbehavior
The sailor was birched for breaking naval regulations

definitions: observe or identify wild birds in their natural environment as hobby
examples: We spent the morning birding at the nature reserve
He birds regularly and has identified over 200 species

definitions: score one stroke under par on a golf hole
examples: She birdied the difficult seventh hole
He managed to birdie three holes during the round

definitions: give birth to a baby or young animal
examples: The mare birthed a healthy foal last night
She birthed twins at the local hospital

definitions: complain about something or someone in an angry persistent way
examples: He constantly bitches about his workload
Stop bitching and start finding solutions to problems

definitions: use teeth to cut into or through something
cause a sharp stinging pain or discomfort especially from cold
begin to have a strong or unpleasant effect on something
examples: The dog bit the mailman on the leg
She bit into the crisp apple
The winter wind bites through thin clothing
The cold air bit at their exposed faces
The new regulations are beginning to bite
Economic sanctions finally began to bite

definitions: stay in a temporary camp without tents or with minimal shelter
examples: The soldiers bivouacked in the forest overnight
The climbers bivouacked on the mountain ledge

definitions: make something black in color or cover with black substance
refuse to handle or deal with something as form of protest
examples: He blacked his face with charcoal for the play
The fire had blacked the kitchen walls
The union blacked all deliveries to the factory
Workers blacked the company's products

definitions: pick or gather blackberries from bushes
examples: We spent the afternoon blackberrying in the woods
Children love to blackberry along the country lanes

definitions: hit someone with a blackjack weapon or similar club
coerce or pressure someone into doing something through force or threats
examples: The thief blackjacked the guard from behind
He was blackjacked and robbed in the alley
They tried to blackjack him into signing the contract
The company blackjacked suppliers into accepting lower prices

definitions: put someone on a list of people who are disapproved of or banned
examples: The studio blacklisted actors with communist sympathies
He was blacklisted from working in the industry

definitions: demand money or favors from someone by threatening to reveal embarrassing information
examples: He blackmailed his boss with photos from the party
She was blackmailed into giving them classified information

definitions: hold someone responsible for something bad that has happened
assign responsibility for a fault or wrong to someone or something
examples: She blamed herself for the accident
Don't blame me for your mistakes
They blamed the failure on poor planning
Critics blame the government for rising prices

definitions: become white or pale especially from shock or fear
briefly immerse vegetables in boiling water then cold water
examples: She blanched when she heard the terrible news
His face blanched at the sight of blood
Blanch the tomatoes before peeling them
The chef blanched the vegetables for the salad

definitions: deliberately ignore or refuse to acknowledge someone
cause your mind to become empty or unable to remember
examples: She blanked him completely at the party
He blanked his former friends after the argument
My mind blanked during the important presentation
I completely blanked on her name

definitions: cover something completely with a thick layer or large quantity
examples: Snow blanketed the entire countryside overnight
Fog blanketed the valley in the early morning

definitions: influence or persuade someone using charming or flattering talk
examples: He tried to blarney his way out of trouble
She could blarney anyone into doing her favors

definitions: blow up or destroy something with explosives or similar force
criticize someone or something very harshly and publicly
play music or make sound at very high volume
examples: Workers blasted through the rock with dynamite
The storm blasted the coastal buildings
The senator blasted the proposed legislation
Critics blasted the movie for its poor plot
Music blasted from speakers throughout the night
He blasted the horn to warn pedestrians

definitions: burn with bright strong flames
shine with bright light or brilliant color
mark a trail or path with signs or marks
examples: The bonfire blazed throughout the night
The building blazed for hours before firefighters arrived
The sunset blazed across the western sky
Her eyes blazed with anger
They blazed a trail through the dense forest
Scouts blazed the path with orange markers

definitions: display or proclaim something prominently or publicly
examples: The newspaper blazoned the scandal across its front page
Their logo was blazoned on billboards throughout the city

definitions: make something white or lighter using chemical substances
become white or pale through exposure to sunlight or chemicals
examples: She bleached the stained sheets with chlorine
The hairdresser bleached her hair platinum blonde
The sun had bleached the curtains over time
Years of exposure bleached the wooden deck

definitions: lose blood from the body due to injury or illness
gradually drain resources money or strength from someone or something
spread from one area into another especially of colors or dyes
examples: His nose bled after the boxing match
The wound continued to bleed despite the bandage
High taxes are bleeding small businesses dry
The project bled money for months
The red ink bled onto the white paper
Dark colors may bleed in hot water

definitions: make a short high-pitched electronic sound
replace offensive words with a bleep sound in broadcasts
examples: The machine bleeps when the cycle is complete
Her pager bleeped during the meeting
They bleeped out the profanity in the interview
The network bleeped several words from the comedy show

definitions: spoil or damage the appearance or quality of something
examples: The scratch blemished the car's perfect paint job
One bad review blemished her otherwise stellar reputation

definitions: mix two or more substances thoroughly so they combine
combine or fit together harmoniously without sharp contrasts
examples: Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy
She blended different spices to create the sauce
The new building blends perfectly with its surroundings
Their voices blended beautifully in the duet

definitions: ask for divine favor or protection for someone or something
give official approval or support to something
endow someone with a particular cherished ability or quality
examples: The priest blessed the congregation at the service
They asked the minister to bless their marriage
The board blessed the merger proposal
Her parents finally blessed their relationship
Nature blessed her with exceptional musical talent
The region is blessed with abundant natural resources

definitions: cause severe damage or disease to plants or areas
spoil or damage something severely especially hopes or ambitions
examples: Disease blighted the entire potato crop
Pollution has blighted the industrial areas
Scandal blighted his political career
Poverty blights the lives of millions

definitions: cause someone to be unable to see permanently or temporarily
cause someone to be unable to think clearly or use good judgment
examples: The explosion blinded him in one eye
Bright headlights blinded the oncoming drivers
Anger blinded him to the consequences
Love had blinded her to his faults

definitions: cover someone's eyes with cloth to prevent them from seeing
examples: They blindfolded the hostages during transport
Children blindfolded each other for the party game

definitions: attack or hit someone from their blind side or when unprepared
examples: The linebacker blindsided the quarterback
The news completely blindsided everyone at the meeting

definitions: close and open the eyes quickly especially involuntarily
shine unsteadily or flash on and off repeatedly
examples: She blinked rapidly in the bright sunlight
He didn't blink during the staring contest
The warning light blinked red continuously
Stars seemed to blink in the clear night sky

definitions: cause blisters to form on skin or surface
attack or criticize someone with harsh intense words
examples: The new shoes blistered her feet badly
Hot sun blistered the paint on the car
The coach blistered the team after their loss
Critics blistered the director's latest film

definitions: attack or bomb a place with intense sustained force
deal with something quickly and with concentrated effort
examples: Enemy planes blitzed the city for three days
The defense blitzed the quarterback repeatedly
We need to blitz through these reports today
She blitzed the housework before guests arrived

definitions: make movement or flow through something difficult or impossible
prevent something from happening or progressing
shape or mold something into a particular form
examples: Fallen trees blocked the road completely
The goalkeeper blocked the penalty kick
Security software blocks malicious websites
Congress blocked the proposed legislation
The milliner blocked the felt into a hat shape
She blocked the sweater after washing it

definitions: seal off a place to prevent goods or people from entering or leaving
examples: Naval forces blockaded the enemy port
Protesters blockaded the building entrances

definitions: write and publish articles or posts on a blog website
examples: She blogs about travel experiences every week
He has been blogging professionally for five years
